title: As a Club, I want General Information returned through the MJC API
custom_preconds:
**DATE RANGE INPUT FORMAT: "fromDate=2017-01-01&toDate=2017-01-02"**
GIVEN the user wants General Information returned through the MJC API
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Ebis Link under Utilities
custom_expected:
THEN then user Will be able to query by PlayerID
AND Will be able to query by ContractID
AND Will be able to query by Last Changed Datestamp Range
AND Fields listed on the linked wiki under General Information section should be added to the API
AND Data in the response must exactly match data on the UI in the General Information section
AND Response should be returned under 2 seconds
AND Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a user of the EBIS Link API, I'd like to see newer, cleaner endpoints for contracts, as noted in the description,
custom_steps:
/contracts/<player_id>
/contracts/<player_id>/minor
/contracts/<player_id>/major
/contracts/<player_id>?fromDate=x&toDate=y
/contracts/<player_id>/minor?fromDate=x&toDate=y
/contracts/<player_id>/major?fromDate=x&toDate=y
/contracts/minor/<mnc_id>
/contracts/major/<mjc_id>
```/contracts/<player_id>
/contracts/<player_id>/minor
/contracts/<player_id>/major
/contracts/<player_id>?fromDate=x&toDate=y
/contracts/<player_id>/minor?fromDate=x&toDate=y
/contracts/<player_id>/major?fromDate=x&toDate=y
/contracts/minor/<mnc_id>
/contracts/major/<mjc_id>

Probably would also add:
/contracts/minor?fromDate=x&toDate=y
/contracts/major?fromDate=x&toDate=y

Difference is these last ones gets all minor/major contracts updated in a certain time period while the other ones in the previous post get the minor/major contracts updated in a certain time period for a specific player

title: As a User, I want to receive an email notification if communication to the WLP fails
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is attempting to perform an action in EBIS that will send data to Winter League Portal (grant, deny, agreement reached checkbox, etc)
custom_steps: WHEN player or Winter League Request information fails to be sent to the WLP because of an error with the data or file
custom_expected:
THEN  an email should be generated detailing the piece of information that failed, along with the Player ID associated with the information and the reason for failure
AND email should be sent to all addresses on the email list (this does NOT use the Email Utility in EBIS)
**NOTE: COORDINATION WITH DEV TEAM REQUIRED, CANNOT BE TESTED VIA FRONT END**

title: As a User, I want attempts to communicate information to the WLP that fail to not be lost forever
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is attempting to take an action in EBIS that will send data to the Winter League Portal (grant, deny, agreement reached checkbox etc)
custom_steps: WHEN the attempt to send information or files to WLP fails because of an inability to establish a connection between the two systems
custom_expected:
THEN the system should queue the items to be sent and continue to try at regular intervals until the system can successfully transmit the information
AND if after a pre-determined amount of time the system can still not communicate the information to the WLP, then the system should cease efforts and send a failure email, per [C1145730]
AND if all retries failed, system should preserve the call semantics in a table so that a batch can be used to later diagnose and/or retry through a batch service
**NOTE: COORDINATION WITH DEV TEAM REQUIRED, CANNOT BE TESTED VIA FRONT END**

title: As a User, I want the salary info modal to default to the correct values
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Salary info modal defaults to correct values
custom_steps: WHEN the user is on Salary info modal
custom_expected:
THEN the defaults should be as follows (PY = Platform Year):
(PY) 1st MJ Contract Checkbox: Checked if player has no MJC or first MJC starts in PY
(PY) MJ Tender Amount: (PY) MJ min tender amount
(PY) MJ Min Tender Amount: see story on min tender amt calcs
(PY) Para 2 Tender Amount: (PY) MN min tender amount
(PY) Para 2 Min Tender Amount: see story on min tender amt calcs
Repeat (PY-1) Bonuses: unchecked
(PY-1) MJ Salary: MJC Base salary in PY-1 plus pro-rated signing bonus
(PY-1) MN Para 2 Salary: Split salary in MJC (if entered)
(PY-1) Earnings Excl Bonuses: Sum of dollars earned as calculated on LRD Payroll impact on payroll tab for PY-1, excluding the bonuses bucket
(PY-1) Total Potential Bonuses: Total offered bonuses in PY-1
Additional Comp in (PY-1) contract: checked if LRD Payroll impact for MJC has >0 amount in the "non-cash comp" bucket
(PY-2) MJ Salary: MJC Base salary in PY-2 plus pro-rated signing bonus
(PY-2) Earnings Excl Bonuses: Sum of dollars earned as calculated on LRD Payroll impact on payroll tab for PY-2, excluding the bonuses bucket

Wire:
http://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=salary_info

title: As a Club User, I want to delete a player from the Central Tender Utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=central_tender_utility
GIVEN a club user is logged in with edit permissions for the Central Tender Utility
AND user is attempting to delete a player from the utility
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the utility in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a trashcan icon for club users
AND clicking the trashcan icon should remove the indicated player
AND if the Tender Sheet is in a state other than Preliminary, the sheet should be moved back to Preliminary when it is saved
ANS when a player is deleted and the Sheet is saved, a clipboard notification should be generated for BOC Admin Users
AND Notification should be as follows:
  -- Type: Central Tender
  -- Org: Org
  -- Player: Player's Name
  -- Description: "ORG has deleted [Player's Name] from the Central Tender Utility."

title: As a BOC User, I want to Tender Transactions Created when I click Finalize button on the Central Tender Widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=central_tender_widget
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Central+Tender+Widget
GIVEN BOC user is attempting to Finalize the CT widget for a certain year
AND one or more players on the CT utility have a Tender Status of "Tendered"
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Finalize" on the CT widget
custom_expected:
THEN clicking the Finalize button should launch an "Are you sure message"
AND Body of the modal should state: "This will create tender transactions for all tendered players.  Are you sure you want to continue?"
AND available buttons should be: Continue and Back
AND clicking back should return the user to the form
AND clicking Continue should launch a blue notification "Transactions being created"
AND system should generate Tender Transactions for all players with a Tender status of "Tendered"
BUT no transactions should be created for Non-Tendered or Signed players
AND the newly created transactions should appear in the players' histories
BUT the transactions should not be clickable/openable

title: As a user I want to see the Create New icon on an employee profile if I have create permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has permission to the following:
  - MJ Contract Admin
  - MN Contract Admin
  - Employee Transactions Admin
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a Create New icon on an Employee Profile: 
Or If they do not have any of these permissions, then they do not see the create new icon on an employee profile.

title: As a user I do not want to see "Employee Transactions" as an option if I don't have create permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to create a new Employee Transaction for an Employee
AND logged in user does NOT have Create Permissions for Employee Transactions
(Does not have the following:
- MJ Contract Admin
- MN Contract Admin
- Employee Transactions Admin)
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user should NOT see the "Transactions" option in the employee create new menu
BUT if the user DOES have the permissions listed above, then the use SHOULD see the "Transactions" option in the Employee Create New menu

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Transactions" will display a secondary and tertiary dropdown.
AND "Assignments" should be an option under the secondary dropdown. 
AND "Assign as 7th Coach" should be an option in the third level dropdown when "Assignments" is selected.
AND Selecting "Assign as 7th Coach" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
Or If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to be able to delete an Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee in Preliminary or Rejected states
custom_expected:
THEN user will see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode.
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
Title: Warning
Body: Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
Hint: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
Buttons: Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
AND If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating an Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user Initials an Assign as 7th Coach transaction for a 7th coach
AND Employee's Current Org is different from logged in club user's Org
custom_steps: WHEN user selects Assign as 7th Coach transaction on the Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should display a blocking message "You do not have permission to create a transaction for an employee that belongs to another Organization. If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact the BOC."
AND clicking "Back" will return the user to the entry point
Or If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.

title: As a user I want to Submit an Assign as 7th Coach to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
AND transaction is in preliminary or rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Submit to BOC" button (Blue for Club users and grey for the BOC)
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
AND After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
AND An approvals item will be generated for the BOC. 
AND The transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =AS7CO Description = Assign as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a BOC user I want to approve an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC, or Rejected status
AND blue "Approve" button is available
custom_steps: WHEN the BOC user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND If applicable, the BOC approvals item is removed.
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND Update Player's Player History: Code =AS7CO Description = Assign as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a BOC user I want to reject an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND grey "Reject" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks "Reject"
custom_expected:
THEN BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
AND The item is removed from the player's history. 
AND The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to suppress an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction has been approved or Reversed for a player
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user is on Assign as 7th Coach transaction in view or Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
AND Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
AND A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when an Assign as 7th Coach is rejected, approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach tx exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN Assign as 7th Coach tx reaches a rejected, approved or reversed status
custom_expected:
THEN a notification will appear on the notification clipboard 
AND Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
Or Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected.
Or Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
AND "Description" will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
AND Player's name will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN user with edit permission logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state.
AND Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND in Preliminary, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
OR In states other than Preliminary, edit only gives clubs access to attach new files. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and AND "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.

See Wireframe: 
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=voluntary_designation

title: As a BOC Approver I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to approve a transaction with an assignment date after the current date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver logs in
AND Assignment date on the Assign as 7th Coach transaction is set after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Approve
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction. If yes, display an error. See Messages #51.

See Error Message #51:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Assignments+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Remove as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in employee profile
AND employee is 7th Coach
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Remove as 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
Or If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
Or If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Remove as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile for 7th Coach
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Employee Transactions" will display a secondary and tertiary dropdown.
AND "Assignments" should be an option under the secondary dropdown. 
AND "Remove as 7th Coach" should be an option in the third level dropdown when "Assignments" is selected.
AND Selecting "Remove as 7th Coach" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
Or If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND  Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.


See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to be prevented from initiating a Remove as 7th Coach transaction for an employee that is not a 7th Coach
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on an employee profile for employee who is not 7th coach
custom_steps: WHEN user selects 'Remove as 7th coach' on the employee Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the employee is currently a 7th Coach.  
AND If not, then display a blocking message. See Messages #11.

See Error Message #11: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a BOC Approver I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to approve a transaction with an assignment date after the current date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver initiated Remove as 7th Coach transaction
AND Assignment date on the Remove as 7th Coach transaction is set after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Approve
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction. If yes, display an error. See Messages #9.

See Error Message #9:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to Submit a Remove as 7th Coach to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user initiated Remove as 7th Coach transaction for 7th coach 
AND transaction is in preliminary or rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Submit to BOC" button (Blue for Club users and grey for the BOC)
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
AND After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
AND An approvals item will be generated for the BOC. 
AND The transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =RM7CO Description = Remove as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Remove as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile for 7th coach
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Remove 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee in Preliminary or Rejected states
custom_expected:
THEN user will see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode.
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
Title: Warning
Body: Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
Hint: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
Buttons: Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a BOC user I want to reject a Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Remove as 7th Coach transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND grey "Reject" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks "Reject"
custom_expected:
THEN BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
AND The item is removed from the player's history. 
AND The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a Remove as 7th Coach transaction for an employee that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user Initials Remove as 7th Coach transaction for a 7th coach
AND Employee's Current Org is different from logged in club user's Org
custom_steps: WHEN user selects Remove as 7th Coach transaction on the Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check the employee's Current Org against the Org of the initiating user. 
AND If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.
AND If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the employee, then display a blocking message. See Messages #1.

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when a Remove as 7th Coach is rejected, approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Remove as 7th Coach tx exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN Remove as 7th Coach tx reaches a rejected, approved or reversed status
custom_expected:
THEN a notification will appear on the notification clipboard
AND Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
OR Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected.
OR Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
AND "Description" will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
AND Player's name will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a BOC user I want to approve a Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Remove as 7th Coach transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC, or Rejected status
AND blue "Approve" button is available
custom_steps: WHEN the BOC user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND If applicable, the BOC approvals item is removed.
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND Update Player's Player History: Code =RM7CO Description = Remove as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields in black font. 
AND All other "Approval" updates per the provided business rules.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Remove as 7th Coach tx exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a BOC
custom_steps: WHEN Remove as 7th Coach tx reaches a approved status
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
AND Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
AND Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND Display reversed transaction in player history with â€œVoided:â€￾ in front of the transaction description. Example:â€￾ Voided: Selection to ML Rosterâ€￾

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to supress a Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Remove as 7th Coach tx exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a BOC
custom_steps: WHEN Remove as 7th Coach tx reaches a approved or Reverse status
custom_expected:
THEN users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
AND Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
AND Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
AND A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Remove as 7th Coach tx exists for a 7th coach
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the existing Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state.
AND Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND In Preliminary and Rejected, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
AND In states other than Preliminary or Rejected, edit only gives clubs access to attach new files. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.

See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_as_7th_coach
